bwwExcerpt: One senses that Crowley knew and loved each one of these men, however weak and spiteful he may act. Joe Mantello's starry and glossy revival maximizes the script's angsty impudence. As waspish host Michael, Jim Parsons tempers his innate sweetness with a complex portrait of a narcissist beset by self-hatred. Matt Bomer adds warmth and solidity as Michael's friend, Donald, also neurotic but kinder and more grounded. Zachary Quinto lobs some of the night's best zingers as birthday boy Harold, a se
